TopicTitle: So I was doing an orbital slingshot to Minmus when...

Articles.Content:
I saw this bad boy on Mun. Yes, I am that low, no, I have no clue what it is. It\'s on the Kerbin side of the Mun though, right about equator high. I\'ll have to make a rover to go check it out, I guess

For anyone looking to do 'discovery,' I guess this would count as a spoiler.
The Mun arch! Hooray!
It\'s for flying under. Whoop!
Wow. If you\'re that high up and see it in that detail, that\'s incredibly HUGE!

Wow. If you\'re that high up and see it in that detail, that\'s incredibly HUGE!

No doubt... Also I\'m relieved to see easter eggs after the comment that they weren\'t working on any secret features anymore.

Wow. If you\'re that high up and see it in that detail, that\'s incredibly HUGE!

I\'m at 2900m, I was actually worried about hitting things on the surface when I did this burn ;P

I was doing a mun landing when I found this independently and decided to land at it. Took a bunch of screenshots.

Next one\'s pretty dark but it shows my lander under the arch with Kerbin in the background.
You saw that and did not punch the brakes full throttle? wow that\'s some mission discipline right there
Wow, I have to land on that when I get home!
Landing next to or under that thing is too easy, so I decided to land on top of it =P

Haha, what the!?

Guessing this was added in 0.15? No ones seen anything like this in previous releases?

Haha, what the!?

Guessing this was added in 0.15? No ones seen anything like this in previous releases?

I.... I....DISCOVERED something?

Woop woop!

I dare somebody to orbit under it!

:3

I dare somebody to orbit under it!

:3

I\'ll work on this later tonight.

I\'ve found 2 of them. Is everyone sure they\'re looking at the same one?

The angle of the sun is different in both screenshots, if you don\'t believe me.

How do the two of them line up? Is it possible to make an orbit that will pass through both of them?

That would be so awesome.

How do the two of them line up? Is it possible to make an orbit that will pass through both of them?

That would be so awesome.

Ultimate Challenge, anyone? Nearly impossible, but I don\'t doubt that someone here can do it.

At first sight, i thought that was some sort of warp device. when your craft fly through it, the craft will be teleported to another warp point... hmm, maybe somewhere close to the sun so you have to run ASAP in order to escape from the sun.
The amateur geologist in me is already working on theories on how such an arch could be formed on a world without the aid of air or water erosion. One thought: Lava bubbles.

It kinda reminds me of this thing:

Don\'t go through it, or you might paradox yourself.

The amateur geologist in me is already working on theories on how such an arch could be formed on a world without the aid of air or water erosion. One thought: Lava bubbles.

I just figured Jeb spent a few weeks with carefully dropped fuel tanks to blow a trailer hitch into the Mun by carefully liquefying the rock, the better to move it around with.
Still, what exactly are those arches.
First thing that I though of is: aliens:) That meme('I\'m not saying it\'s aliens... but it\'s aliens'). It\'s a really interesting object this arch.

The amateur geologist in me is already working on theories on how such an arch could be formed on a world without the aid of air or water erosion. One thought: Lava bubbles.

There\'s no saying that the Kerbus system has ANYTHING in common with the Terran system. Maybe their Mun is young enough to still have a liquid core and that was a lava spout.... food for thought.

There\'s no saying that the Kerbus system has ANYTHING in common with the Terran system. Maybe their Mun is young enough to still have a liquid core and that was a lava spout.... food for thought.

No way lava would solidify quickly enough for that...

I tried landing near it, but I came down to quickly and my rocket fell over. Heres a picture of my rocket sled going under the arch
